level.text: As used in this chapter, the following terms have the meanings ascribed:
Act – the District of Columbia Board of Veterinary Practice Act of 1982, D.C. Law 4-171, D.C. Code §§2-2701 to 2-2737 (1988 Repl. Vol.).

Animal facility – fixed or mobile establishment, veterinary hospital, animal hospital, or premises wherein the practice of veterinary medicine or any part thereof is performed, including a mobile clinic.
Board – the District of Columbia Board of Veterinary Examiners for the District of Columbia, established by the Act.
Director – the Director of the Department of Consumer and Regulatory Affairs, or the Director’s designee.
License – a license to operate an animal facility under this chapter.
Licensee – a person holding a license.
Mobile clinic – an ambulatory facility used in the practice of veterinary medicine.
Veterinarian – a person licensed to practice veterinary medicine under the Act and accordance with chapter 28 of Title 17 DCMR
